ch.ethz.rtc.kernel
Class CurveSubSegmentIterator

java.lang.Object
  ch.ethz.rtc.kernel.CurveSubSegmentIterator

public class CurveSubSegmentIterator
extends java.lang.Object

CurveSubSegmentIterator provides an iterator that iterates over the single curve sub-segments of two curves.

Since:
Version:
$Id: CurveSubSegmentIterator.java 377 2007-03-20 20:10:09Z nikolays $
Author:
Ernesto Wandeler
Proposed Rating:
Yellow (wandeler@tik.ee.ethz.ch)
Accepted Rating:
none
JUnit Rating:
Yellow (wandeler@tik.ee.thz.ch)

Constructor Summary
CurveSubSegmentIterator(Curve a, Curve b)
          Creates an CurveSubSegmentIterator that iterates over all Subsegments of the Curves a and b.

Subsegments are defined as follows:
X_A is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve a.
X_B is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve b.
X_AB is the ordered union of X_A and X_B without any duplicates.
X_AB contains the x-values of the start and end points of all Subsegments of the Curve a and b.
CurveSubSegmentIterator(Curve a, Curve b, double xMax)
          Creates an CurveSubSegmentIterator that iterates over all Subsegments of the Curves a and b, from x=0 up to and including x=xMax.

Subsegments are defined as follows:
X_A is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all CurveSegments of Curve a from x=0 up to x=xMax.
X_B is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all CurveSegments of Curve b from x=0 up to x=xMax.
X_AB is the ordered union of X_A and X_B without any duplicates.
X_AB contains the x-values of the start and end points of all Subsegments of the Curve a and b.

Constructor Detail

CurveSubSegmentIterator

public CurveSubSegmentIterator(Curve a,
                               Curve b,
                               double xMax)
Creates an CurveSubSegmentIterator that iterates over all Subsegments of the Curves a and b, from x=0 up to and including x=xMax.

Subsegments are defined as follows:
X_A is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all CurveSegments of Curve a from x=0 up to x=xMax.
X_B is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all CurveSegments of Curve b from x=0 up to x=xMax.
X_AB is the ordered union of X_A and X_B without any duplicates.
X_AB contains the x-values of the start and end points of all Subsegments of the Curve a and b. A Subsegment therefore starts at X_AB[i] and ends at X_AB[i+1].

Subsegments are of interest, because both Curves a and b are continuous and do not change their slope during a subsegment.

Parameters:
a - the first Curve.
b - the second Curve.
xMax - the upper value up to which this CurveSubSegmentIterator should iterate.

CurveSubSegmentIterator

public CurveSubSegmentIterator(Curve a,
                               Curve b)
Creates an CurveSubSegmentIterator that iterates over all Subsegments of the Curves a and b.

Subsegments are defined as follows:
X_A is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve a.
X_B is the ordered list of the x-values of the start-points of all Segments of Curve b.
X_AB is the ordered union of X_A and X_B without any duplicates.
X_AB contains the x-values of the start and end points of all Subsegments of the Curve a and b. A Subsegment therefore starts at X_AB[i] and ends at X_AB[i+1].

Subsegments are of interest, because both Curves a and b are continuous and do not change their slope during a subsegment.

Parameters:
a - the first Curve.
b - the second Curve.

public boolean aIsNew()
